brief:
Calculates the angle (in radians) from a specified point to the
 coordinate origin as measured from the positive x-axis
name: atan2()
description: Calculates the angle (in radians) from a specified point to the coordinate origin as measured from the positive x-axis. Values are returned as a float in the range from PI to -PI. The atan2() function is most often used for orienting geometry to the position of the cursor. Note: The y-coordinate of the point is the first parameter and the x-coordinate is the second due the structure of calculating the tangent.
